spans.text: Taki walked to the center of the slope's end, where a convenience store she often visited was located. The bluish neon sign emitted a warm, familiar glow, making it feel especially welcoming in the dim, deserted twilight.
(Now that I think about it, the beer I bought earlier is already gone, and I’m running out of those nutritional jelly packs too. Should I restock while I’m here?)
(Nothing’s going right anyway, might as well grab some booze to relax.)
(Actually, forget it… I’m really not in the mood for shopping today.)
